column5: Finally got out musky fishing for the first time this year last weekend.  Caught this guy trolling on a 10 inch beleiver.    He put up a great fight.  He stayed deep, taking drag on my Calcutta 400 for a few mins.  When he got to the boat I was greated with 3 nice jumps.  A few minites later we caught a 34 incher on the same lure but didn't take pictures.  Both fish were released of course.
way to go!! Thassa nice one   Somewhere in the mid-40's?
Ya call that Little       Beauty of a fish.  Congrats. I have yet to catch anything trolling a Believer ... but I keep on tryin'
What a dink!  Beauty ski ... i didn't know roethlisburger fished pigeon!?!

Thanks guys, I didn't measure him because I was concerned with getting him back in the water.  I caught a 45 incher last year on Pigeon and looking at the pictures side by side this fish looks longer.  I know where he lives now so I will measure him next time  Rich, the believer is the only musky lure I troll with anymore.  Last year I caught > 10 skis trolling believers on Pigeon.  Most of them on the walleye colour believer.  I have a really good pattern down now as to where to troll and how deep.
Real nice fish and kudos to you for being more concerned with a successful release than a measurement!
Great looking ski for sure    Congratulations Whitemikeca and thanks for sharing Leechman
Really healthy looking fish Pigeon is a excellent lake for muskies. I've caught a few up there as well. Thanks for sharing!

Good job man!  You said it, where, how deep... you know what your lure is doing in the water, combine that with knowing where they live, you cannot miss...  well except on those days where you miss.... :-)
Beauty lunge right there!!!...thanks for sharing your outing and congrats for gettin' er back in the water quickly...

HI Thought this may help with the depth - great thread - I fish same area using same technique - i have trouble downloading image under 250K any help would be great  All I can say is double cowgirl gold with silver blades is unbeatable at present time.  Good luck all
